name: Iran
description: Iran, officially the Islamic Republic of Iran, is a transcontinental country in Southwest Asia. It is bordered by Iraq to the east, Afghanistan and Turkmenistan to the northeast, Pakistan and Azerbaijan to the northwest, Turkey to the northwest, Armenia and Georgia to the northeast, and the Caspian Sea to the north. Iran possesses a rich and ancient history, diverse landscapes ranging from deserts and mountains to coastal plains, and a vibrant culture.

quickFacts.label: Population
quickFacts.description: Iran has the second-largest population in Western Asia.
quickFacts.detail: The majority of the population lives in urban areas, particularly in Tehran, Mashhad, and Isfahan.

quickFacts.label: Capital
quickFacts.description: Tehran is the bustling capital and largest city of Iran.
quickFacts.detail: It's a modern metropolis with historical sites and a vibrant cultural scene.

quickFacts.label: Area
quickFacts.description: Iran covers a vast area, making it the second-largest country in Asia.
quickFacts.detail: Its diverse geography includes mountains, deserts, and fertile plains.

quickFacts.label: Official Language
quickFacts.description: Persian is the official language and the most widely spoken.
quickFacts.detail: Arabic script is used for writing.

quickFacts.label: GDP
quickFacts.description: Iran's economy is largely based on oil and gas.

climateData.title: Climate of Iran
climateData.description: Iran experiences a wide range of climates due to its diverse geography. Generally, it's a hot desert climate, but variations occur across the country.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Summer (June - August)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Summers are extremely hot and dry, particularly in the central and southern regions.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Autumn (September - November)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Autumn brings pleasant temperatures and clear skies, making it an ideal time for outdoor activities.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Winter (December - February)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Winters are cold and snowy in the northern and mountainous regions, while the southern regions remain relatively mild.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Spring (March - May)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Spring is a beautiful season with blooming flowers and pleasant temperatures.

naturalWonders.name: Mount Damavand
naturalWonders.description: Mount Damavand is Iran's highest peak and one of the world's tallest volcanoes. It's a challenging but rewarding climb for experienced mountaineers.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: Located in the Alborz Mountains, Damavand's summit reaches 5,610 meters (18,404 feet). Its volcanic history is evident in its distinctive cone shape and the presence of fumaroles.
viewingTips: Acclimatize to the altitude before attempting the summit.
Check weather conditions before starting your climb.

naturalWonders.name: Kavir Desert
naturalWonders.description: The Kavir Desert, meaning 'Sea of Sand,' is one of Iran's two deserts. It's a vast expanse of sand dunes and rocky terrain.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The Kavir Desert is divided into Eastern and Western Kavir. The Western Kavir is more sandy, while the Eastern Kavir is characterized by rocky outcrops and salt plains. It's a unique ecosystem with specialized flora and fauna.
viewingTips: Bring plenty of water and sunscreen.

naturalWonders.name: Chalus National Park
naturalWonders.description: Chalus National Park is renowned for its ancient beech forests, some of the oldest in the world.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The park is home to a diverse range of flora and fauna, including rare bird species and endemic plants. The trees are estimated to be over 1,000 years old.

ecosystemData.title: Ecosystems of Iran
ecosystemData.overview: Iran's ecosystems are incredibly diverse, ranging from arid deserts to lush forests and alpine meadows. These ecosystems support a rich array of plant and animal life.

conservationStatus.protectedAreas: Approximately 15% of Iran's land area is protected within national parks and reserves.

biodiversityCategories.name: Mammals
biodiversityCategories.description: Iran is home to a variety of mammals, including lions, tigers, leopards, wolves, foxes, and gazelles.

statistics.details: Threatened by habitat loss and poaching.
Diverse range of rodents and shrews.

biodiversityCategories.name: Birds
biodiversityCategories.description: Iran is a birdwatcher's paradise, with over 600 bird species recorded.

statistics.details: Important stopover point for birds migrating between Asia and Africa.
Several bird species found only in Iran.

notableSpecies.name: Black Francolin
notableSpecies.significance: A ground-dwelling bird found in grasslands.

activities.title: Outdoor Activities in Iran
activities.description: Iran offers a wide range of outdoor activities for adventure seekers and nature enthusiasts.

activityCategories.name: Hiking
activityCategories.description: Explore Iran's diverse landscapes on foot.

activities.name: Mount Damavand Trek
activities.description: A challenging trek to the summit of Iran's highest peak.

activityCategories.name: Water Sports
activityCategories.description: Enjoy water activities in Iran's Caspian Sea and coastal regions.

activities.name: Caspian Sea Fishing
activities.description: Cast a line and try your luck at catching fish in the Caspian Sea.
